result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Chaney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge  May Not have contact with Michael Abbey unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Amended
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Watson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Deft is sworn in & testified.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years and 2 months WSP; 14 months initial confinement w/credit for 429 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.
With Atty Watson and ADA McNeill the time of the PLEAS on 3/11/15 is changed from 2:30pm to 10:30am.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  PLEAS set over to 3/11/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
Atty Watson reports that the case is resolved, therefore a PLEAS is set for 3/6/15 at 9am; the JS of 3/9/15 is cancelled.
